title: Customer's gun discharges, grazing Weis supermarket worker in Reading
content:
Reading police were called to a Weis parking lot Monday where a customer accidentally shot an employee, a store official said.
Company spokesman Dennis Curtin said an associate was grazed by a bullet after a gun carried by a customer accidentlally discharged at its store located in the 2000 block of North 13th Street about 10:50 a.m.
“All reports at this time indicate that this was an unfortunate accident,” Curtin said in a press release Monday afternoon.
Curtin said the No. 1 concern and priority at this moment is the health of the associate who had been taken to the hospital and released later for injuries that were not life-threatening.
Police have released no further details about the incident.
